location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 373: Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Henry Bartle Edward Frere, Commissioner in Scinde [Sindh], Kurrachee [Karachi]

mods.abstract: This letter from Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, addressed to Henry Bartle Edward Frere, Commissioner in Scinde [Sindh], Kurrachee [Karachi], is a letter of introduction written for a horse dealer who has shipped thirty horses to the market in Kurrachee. Kemball writes that the dealer will be travelling in person with the consignment and therefore he is furnishing him with this letter, and has assured him that his horses, if suited to Government purposes, will be purchased by the Standing Committee in Kurrachee.
